text: The Verrazzano-Narrows Bridge (also referred to as the Verrazzano Bridge, locally as the Verrazzano, and formerly as the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge or Narrows Bridge) is a suspension bridge in New York City. It connects the boroughs of Staten Island and Brooklyn."Biggest Bridge to Span Busiest Harbor." Popular Science, June 1955, pp. 90â€“93; retrieved 2012-3-25. The bridge is named for the Italian explorer Giovanni da Verrazzano. His ship was the first to enter New York Harbor.Fertig, Beth. "Verrazano Bridge Turns 40," WNYC. November 21, 2004; retrieved 2012-3-25. When construction was finished, the Verrazzano-Narrows was the longest suspension bridge in the world. It was the longest until the Humber Bridge surpassed that length in 1981. ==References== ==Other websites== * New York City MTA, Verrazano-Narrows Bridge * Structurae, Verrazano-Narrows Bridge * Transportation Alternatives, Verrazano-Narrows Bridge, bike-pedestrian path Category:Bridges in New York (state) Category:Steel bridges Category:Staten Island Category:Brooklyn Category:Suspension bridges Category:1964 establishments in New York (state) Category:1969 establishments in the United States Category:1960s establishments in New York (state)
